alert.note: Alert for Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:18PM EST until January 03 at 11:52PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northeast Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Northeast Kentucky, Lewis. In South Central Ohio, Scioto. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 218 PM EST, While heavy rain had ended over the area, minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Greenup, South Shore, South Webster, Franklin Furnace, Camp Dix, Sciotodale, Head of Grassy, Garrison, Tannery, Haverhill, Sciotoville, Kinniconick, Powellsville and Emerson.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
